RELATIONSHIP MOVES

COMPANION MOVES

Advance

When you focus on your skills, receive training, find inspiration, gain a companion, or one of these does the former, grows stronger, sharpen its senses or learns a new trick, you may...

Oathkeeper

  • Upgrade a stat for 8 experience.
  • Reduce any stat by 1 and add +1 to any other for 2 experience.
  • Upgrade a weapon proficiency for 2 experience.
  • Upgrade an effort level for 1 experience.
  • Acquire a companion asset for asset health+2 in experience.
  • Acquire an asset for 3 experience.
  • Upgrade an asset for 2 experience.

Humanoid Companion

  • Upgrade a stat for 6 experience.
  • Reduce any stat by 1 and add +1 to any other for 1 experience.
  • Upgrade the asset for 2 experience.
  • Upgrade a weapon proficiency for 2 experience.
  • Upgrade the asset for 2 experience.

Non-humanoid Companion

  • Upgrade a stat for 6 experience.
  • Reduce any stat by 1 and add +1 to any other for 1 experience.
  • Increase its protection for its next level in experience.
  • Increase its Face Danger/Clash addition for 4 experience.
  • Make piercing 1 harm for one of its attacks for its next piercing harm level in experience (maximum is 3 piercing harm per attack).
  • Upgrade an attack proficiency for 1 experience.
  • Add a secondary attack for its asset health in experience.
  • Upgrade the asset for 2 experience.
Ironcrunch - page X
Aid Your Ally

When you Secure an Advantage in direct support of an ally, and score a hit, they (instead of you) can take the benefits of the move.

Ironcrunch - page X
Ask the Oracle

When you seek to resolve questions, discover details in the world, determine how other characters respond, or trigger encounters or events, you may

  • Draw a conclusion: Decide the answer based on the most interesting and obvious result.
  • Ask a yes/no question: Decide the odds of a yes, and roll on the table below to check the answer.
  • Pick two: Envision two options. Rate one as likely, and roll on the table below to see if it is true. If not, it is the other.
  • Spark an idea: Brainstorm or use a random prompt.
11 or greater Almost Certain
26 or greaterLikely
51 or greater50/50
76 or greaterUnlikely
91 or greater Small Chance
On a match, an extreme result or twist has occurred.
Ironcrunch - page X
Battle

When you fight a battle, and it happens in a blur, envision your objective and roll. If you primarily fight

  • At range, or using speed and your surroundings to your advantage: Roll +edge.
  • Depending on your courage and others: Roll +heart.
  • In close to overpower your opponents: Roll +iron.
  • Using trickery to befuddle your opponents: Roll +shadow.
  • Using careful tactics to outsmart your opponents: Roll +wits.

On a strong hit, you achieve your objective with a hard-won victory. Choose one of the weak hit options of the End the Fight move.

On a weak hit, you achieve your objective, but not without a significant cost. Choose two of the weak hit options of the End the Fight move.

On a miss, you are defeated and the objective is lost to you. Pay the Price.

Ironcrunch - page X
Burn Momentum

When you make a move, and have positive momentum, you may set your momentum to your reset value and cancel any challenge dice that are less than your current momentum value.

Ironcrunch - page X
Check Your Gear

When you check to see if you have a specific helpful item, and you have at least +1 supply, roll +supply.

On a strong hit, you have it. Take +2 momentum.

On a weak hit, you have it, but your resources are diminished. Take +2 momentum and suffer -1 supply.

On a miss, you dont have it and the situation grows more perilous. Pay the Price.

Ironcrunch - page X
Clash

When your foe has initiative and you fight back, determine if you are hitting your foes protection or breaking their defense rating. If your foes protection is 0 or you are doing the latter, fix one challenge die as per your foes defense rating. Then, envision the contending. If you

  • Fight in close quarters: Roll +iron.
  • Exchange a volley at range, shoot at an advancing foe, or fight with a precise weapon: Roll +edge.

If you are using two light weapons, add +the harm of one of them to this move.

On a strong hit, Inflict Harm and choose one. You have the initiative.

  • You get in position: Take +2 momentum.
  • You find an opening: Inflict +1 harm.

On a weak hit, choose one.

  • Inflict Harm and Pay the Price. Your foe has initiative.
  • Take the initiative if you used a shield.

If you used a shield or attacked at ranged, also choose one.

  • You are overwhelmed: Suffer -2 momentum.
  • Your shield loses durability: Reduce its Face Danger/Clash addition by 1.
  • You wasted ammo: Suffer -1 supply.
  • The thrown weapon you used is lost or destroyed.

On a miss, you are outmatched. As above, but you don't Inflict Harm. Your foe has the initiative.

Ironcrunch - page X
Companion Becomes Unconditional

When your conditional companion is determined to follow you, envision how they express their resolution to stand by your side unconditionally. Then, acquire a companion asset to represent them in exchange for the asset health+1 experience. Erase the goal and drives fields from their companion sheet. You no longer use their loyalty track.

Ironcrunch - page X
Compel

When you persuade someone to do something, envision your approach and roll. If you...

  • Charm, pacify, barter, or convince: Roll +heart (add +2 if you share a bond).
  • Threaten or incite: Roll +iron.
  • Lie or swindle: Roll +shadow.
  • Flaunting or boasting: Roll +wealth or +supply.

On a strong hit, theyll do what you want or share what they know. Take +2 momentum. If you use this exchange to Gather Information, make that move now and add +2.

On a weak hit, as above, but they ask something of you in return; envision what they want. If you are making this move to persuade a conditional companion, suffer -1 loyalty instead.

On a miss, they refuse or make a demand which costs you greatly. Pay the Price; if you are making this move by interacting with a conditional companion, suffer -1 loyalty instead.

Ironcrunch - page X
Conditional Companion Abandons

When your conditional companion has fulfilled their goal or is no longer willing to follow you, they will leave you at the next opportunity.

Ironcrunch - page X
Conditional Companion Acts

When a conditional companion is in position to make a move according to their drives, motivations or the fulfillment of their goal, they do so without suffering -loyalty. Make the move by rolling +their stat.

Ironcrunch - page X
Delve the Depths

When you traverse an area within a perilous site, envision your surroundings. Then, consider your approach. If you navigate this area

  • With haste: Roll +edge.
  • With stealth or trickery: Roll +shadow.
  • With observation, intuition, or expertise: Roll +wits.

On a strong hit, you delve deeper. Mark progress and Find an Opportunity.

On a weak hit, roll on the following table according to your stat.

On a miss, Reveal a Danger.

Edge
Shadow
Wits
Weak Hit Result
1-45 (45%)
1-30 (30%)
1-40 (40%)
Mark progress and Reveal a Danger.
46-65 (20%)
31-65 (35%)
41-55 (15%)
Mark progress.
66-75 (10%)
66-90 (25%)
56-80 (25%)
Choose one: Mark progress or Find an Opportunity.
76-80 (5%)
91-99 (9%)
81-99 (19%)
Take both: Mark progress and Find an Opportunity.
81-100 (20%)
100 (1%)
100 (1%)
Mark progress twice and Reveal a Danger.
Ironcrunch - page X
Discover a Site

When you resolve to enter a perilous site in pursuit of an objective, choose the theme and domain which best represent its nature, and give it a rank.

  • Troublesome site: 3 progress per area.
  • Dangerous site: 2 progress per area.
  • Formidable site: 1 progress per area.
  • Extreme site: 2 ticks per area.
  • Epic site: 1 tick per area.

If you are returning to a previously explored site, roll both challenge dice, take the lowest value, and clear that number of progress boxes.

Then, Delve the Depths to explore this place.

Ironcrunch - page X
Draw the Circle

When you challenge someone to a formal duel, or accept a challenge, roll +heart. If you share a bond with this community, add +2.

On a strong hit, take +2 momentum. You may also choose any boasts and take +2 momentum for each.

On a weak hit, you may choose up to two boasts in exchange for +2 momentum for each.

  • Grant first strike: Your foe has initiative.
  • Bare yourself: Take no benefit of armor or shield.
  • Hold no iron: Take no benefit of weapons.
  • Bloody yourself: Endure Harm (1d3P harm) with no addition.
  • To the death: This fight must end with death.

On a miss, you begin the duel at a disadvantage. Pay the Price.

Ironcrunch - page X
End the Fight

Progress Move

When your foes health is below 10 for harm suffered, you may resolve the outcome of this fight. If you do, roll the challenge dice and compare to your progress.

On a strong hit, this foe is no longer in the fight. They are killed, out of action, flee, or surrender as appropriate to the situation and your intent.

On a weak hit, as above, but you must also choose one.

  • Its worse than you thought: Endure Harm with no armor addition.
  • You are overcome: Endure Stress.
  • You harvest the spoils of the battle: Take a condition.
  • You suffer collateral damage: Something of value is lost or broken (suffer -supply or -wealth), or someone important must pay the cost.
  • A new danger or foe appears, or an existing danger worsens: Suffer-2 momentum.
  • Others wont forget or you are marked for vengeance: Suffer -3 momentum.
  • An objective falls out of reach: Forsake Your Vow.

On a miss, choose one.

  • Your foe has not given up; set their health to 50% of their maximum, rounding down. Then, Pay the Price.
  • You have lost this fight.
Ironcrunch - page X
Endure Harm

When you face physical damage, subtract your armors protection to the harm and suffer -health equal to the remaining harm. If your health is reduced 0, suffer -momentum equal to any remaining -health.

Then roll +iron.

On a strong hit, you stand firm. If your health is suffering harm, choose one.

  • Shake it off: If your health is greater than 0, suffer up to -2 momentum in exchange for the same amount of +health.
  • Embrace the pain: Take +2 momentum.

On a weak hit, you press on. If you wear armor which values are not at its minimum (0), choose one.

  • It loses coverage: Reduce its Endure Harm addition by 1.
  • It loses resistance: Suffer -1 to its protection.
  • You stumble: Suffer -2 momentum.

On a miss, also suffer -1 momentum. If you wear an armor which values are not at its minimum (0), choose as above. If you are at 0 health, you must take the wounded or maimed condition (if currently not taken) or roll on the following table.


1-10 (10%)The harm is mortal. Face Death.
11-20 (10%)Take the dying condition.
21-35 (15%)Take theunconscious condition.
36-50 (15%)Take the reeled condition.
51-100 (50%)You are battered but still standing.
Ironcrunch - page X
Endure Stress

When you face mental shock or despair, suffer -spirit equal to your foes rank or as appropriate to the situation. If your spirit is reduced to 0, suffer -momentum equal to any remaining -spirit.

Then, roll +spirit or +heart, whichever is higher.

On a strong hit, choose one.

  • Shake it off: If your spirit is greater than 0, suffer -1 momentum in exchange for +1 spirit
  • Embrace the darkness: Take +2 momentum

On a weak hit, you press on.

On a miss, also suffer -1 momentum. If you are at 0 spirit, take the shaken or corrupted condition (if currently not taken) or roll on the following table.


1-10 (10%)You are overwhelmed. Face Desolation.
11-25 (15%)You give up. Forsake Your Vow (if possible, one relevant to your current crisis). If this is a companion, Test Their Loyalty.
26-50 (25%)You give in to a fear or compulsion, and act against your better instincts. Manifest Insanity.
51-80 (30%)You persevere.
81-85 (5%)You get a moment of clarity in the eye of the storm. If you have the shaken condition card, discard it. Take +4 spirit and +8 momentum. Then, add +2 to your next move.
86-90 (5%)You get virtuous in the face of chaos. If you have the shaken condition card, discard it. Then, take +4 spirit and draw up to your maximum of resilience cards.
91-95 (5%)Your body harvest vigor. If you have the shaken condition card, discard it. Then, take +4 spirit and +1d12 health.
96-100 (5%)Your spirit shines brightest against a backdrop of desolation. If you have the shaken condition card, discard it. Then, take +8 spirit.
Ironcrunch - page X
Enter the Fray

When you enter in combat, determine who is in control. If you are...

  • Reacting: Roll +edge.
  • Facing off: Roll +heart.
  • Charging: Roll +iron.
  • Ambushing: Roll +shadow.
  • Ambushed: Roll +wits.

On a strong hit, take +4 momentum. You have initiative.

On a weak hit, choose one.

  • Bolster your position: Take +4 momentum. Your foe has initiative.
  • Prepare to act: Take initiative.

On a miss, combat begins with you at a disadvantage. Pay the Price. Your foe has initiative.

Ironcrunch - page X
Escape the Depths

When you flee or withdraw from a site, consider the situation and your approach. If you...

  • Find the fastest way out: Roll +edge.
  • Steel yourself against the horrors of this place: Roll +heart.
  • Fight your way out: Roll +iron.
  • Keep out of sight: Roll +shadow.
  • Retrace your steps or locate an alternate path: Roll +wits.

On a strong hit, you make your way safely out of the site. Take +2 momentum.

On a weak hit, you find your way out, but this place exacts its price. Choose one.

  • You are weary or wounded: Endure Harm with no armor addition (as per the sites rank, piercing).
  • The experience leaves you shaken: Endure Stress (as per the sites rank).
  • Your body or mind are marked. Take a condition.
  • You are delayed, and it costs you. Suffer -momentum as per the sites rank.
  • You face a new complication as you emerge from the depths. Suffer -1 momentum.
  • A denizen plots their revenge. Suffer -3 momentum.

On a miss, a dire threat or imposing obstacle stands in your way. Reveal a Danger. If you survive, you may make your escape.

Ironcrunch - page X
Face a Setback

When your momentum is at its minimum (-6), make a move if your action die matches your negative momentum, you must cancel your action die.

If you suffer additional -momentum, choose one.

  • Exchange each additional -momentum for any combination of -health, -spirit, -supply, -wealth or -companions loyalty as appropriate to the circumstances.
  • Envision an event or discovery which undermines your progress in a current quest, journey or fight. Then, for each additional -momentum, clear 1 unit of progress on that track per its rank (troublesome=clear 3 progress; dangerous=clear 2 progress; formidable=clear 1 progress; extreme=clear 2 ticks; epic=clear 1 tick).
Ironcrunch - page X
Face Danger

When you attempt something risky or react to an imminent threat, envision your action and roll. If you act...

  • With speed, agility, or precision: Roll +edge.
  • With charm, loyalty, or courage: Roll +heart.
  • With aggressive action, forceful defense, strength, or endurance: Roll +iron.
  • With deception, stealth, or trickery: Roll +shadow.
  • With expertise, insight, or observation: Roll +wits.

On a strong hit, you are successful. Take +2 momentum.

On a weak hit, you succeed, but face a troublesome cost. Choose one.

  • You are delayed, lose advantage, or face a new danger: Suffer -1 momentum (-2 if you used a shield).
  • Your shield loses durability: Reduce its Face Danger/Clash addition by 1.
  • You are tired or hurt: Endure Harm (1d3P harm).
  • You are dispirited or afraid: Endure Stress (1 stress).
  • You sacrifice resources: Suffer -1 supply or -1 wealth.
  • You get a negative condition: Take a condition.

On a miss, you fail, or your progress is undermined by a dramatic and costly turn of events. Pay the Price. If you are in combat.

Ironcrunch - page X
Face Death

When you are brought to the brink of death, roll +heart.

On a strong hit, death rejects you.

On a weak hit, choose one.

  • You die, but not before making a noble sacrifice. Envision your final moments.
  • Death desires something of you in exchange for your life. Envision what it wants, and Swear an Iron Vow (formidable or extreme) to complete that quest. If you fail to score a hit when you Swear an Iron Vow, or refuse the quest, you are dead. Otherwise, you return to the mortal world and are now cursed. You may only clear the cursed condition by completing the quest.

On a miss, you are dead.

Ironcrunch - page X
Face Desolation

When you are brought to the brink of desolation, roll +heart.

On a strong hit, you resist and press on.

On a weak hit, choose one.

  • Your spirit or sanity breaks, but not before you make a noble sacrifice. Envision your final moments.
  • You see a vision of a dreaded event coming to pass. Envision that dark future, and Swear an Iron Vow (formidable or extreme) to prevent it. If you fail to score a hit when you Swear an Iron Vow, or refuse the quest, you are lost. Otherwise, you return to your senses and are now tormented. You may only clear the tormented condition by completing the quest.

On a miss, you succumb to despair or horror and are lost.

Ironcrunch - page X
Find an Opportunity

When you encounter a helpful situation or feature within a travel waypoint or a site, roll to determine what kind of opportunity you encounter.

1-55 (25%)Favorable Area.
56-80 (35%)Benign Character Encounter.
81-100 (40%)Item Finding
1-11(11%)The travel took shorter than expected. Take +1 momentum.
12-20 (9%)Elements of this area can be used to leverage your travel. If you Undertake a Journey, you may reroll any dice.
21-28 (8%)There is a path that seems to lead towards your destination. If you follow it, add +2 when you Undertake a Journey.
29-35 (7%)The travel has cleared your mind. If you Hearten, reroll any dice.
36-42 (7%)This seems to be an ideal place to find a moment of peace. If you Hearten, add +2.
43-49 (7%)This seems to be an ideal place to bolster your reserves. If you Resupply, add +2.
50-55 (6%)This seems to be a place safe enough to rest and recover for several hours. If you Make Camp, add +2.
56-61 (6%)You find a healthy settlement. If you Sojourn, add +1.
62-66 (5%)This area offers a captivating ambience or comfortable environment. If you Hearten, take +1 spirit on a hit.
67-71 (5%)This area offers enough to bolster your reserves if you dedicate enough to it. If you Resupply and score hit, you may suffer -1 momentum in exchange for +1 supply.
72-76 (5%)This waypoint offers more than needed for a modest rest. If you Make Camp, and score a hit, you may choose an extra option.
77-80 (4%)You seem to be closer to your destination than expected. Mark an additional progress in your journey track.
81-83 (3%)This area offers just what you need to camp. If you Make Camp, you may reroll any dice.
84-86 (3%)You reach this waypoint just at an opportune time to bolster your reserves. If you Resupply now, you may reroll any dice.
87-88 (2%)There is a hidden passage that could be a shortcut. If you Reach Your Destination, you may reroll any dice.
89-96 (8%)You reach a location of interest related to one of your quests or that might lead to one. Take +2 momentum.
97-98 (2%)Choose one result from this table.
99-100 (2%)Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur.
1-16 (16%)You encounter a traveler or denizen who might provide you guide in exchange for something of value. If you agree, suffer -1 wealth or -2 supply (your choice) in exchange for adding +3 next time you Undertake a Journey for this travel.
17-30 (14%)You encounter a traveler or denizen willing to provide you guide and supply. If he does, add +1 next time you Undertake a Journey for this travel and take +1 supply.
31-38 (8%)You encounter a traveler or denizen who might provide you health care in exchange for something of value. If you agree, suffer -1 wealth or -2 supply (your choice) in exchange for making the Hearten move now and add +3.
39-46 (8%)You encounter a traveler or denizen who might rise your spirit in exchange for something of value. If you agree, suffer -1 wealth or -2 supply (your choice) in exchange for making the Heal move now and add +3.
47-53 (7%)You encounter a traveler or denizen willing to rise your spirit. If he does, Hearten now and add +2.
54-60 (7%)You encounter a traveler or denizen willing to give you first aid. If he does, Heal now and add +2.
61-70 (10%)You encounter a provision trader.
71-75 (5%)You encounter an equipment trader.
76-79 (4%)You encounter a traveler or denizen with the potential of being a conditional companion with the goal of serving as hireling and the drive of getting wealth. If you Take a Conditional Companion, add +1.
80-83 (4%)You encounter a traveler or denizen with the potential of being a conditional companion. Take +1 momentum.
84-86 (3%)You encounter one or more travelers or denizens in need for help and with the means to reward you.
87-95 (9%)You encounter one or more characters related to one of you quests or that might lead to one. Take +2 momentum.
96-98 (3%)Roll twice more on this table. Use one result.
99-100 (2%)Choose one result from this table.
1-14 (14%)You find resources that bolster your reserves. Take +1 supply.
15-26 (12%)You find resources that bolster your reserves. Take +2 supply.
27-35 (9%)You find some valuable goods. Take +2 wealth.
36-42 (7%)You find some valuable goods. Take +2 wealth.
43-47 (5%)You find a consumable item of your choice or as appropriate to the circumstances.
48-51 (4%)You find two consumable items of your choice or as appropriate to the circumstances.
52-56 (5%)You find a weapon of cost d4 wealth cost or less of your choice as appropriate to the circumstances.
57-59 (3%)You find a weapon of cost d6 wealth or less of your choice as appropriate to the circumstances.
60-61 (2%)You find a weapon of cost d8+1 wealth or less of your choice as appropriate to the circumstances.
62-64 (3%)You find a shield of cost d4+1 wealth or less of your choice as appropriate to the circumstances.
65-66 (2%)You find a shield of cost d6+1 wealth or less of your choice as appropriate to the circumstances.
67-69 (3%)You find an armor of cost 1d4+3 wealth or less of your choice or as appropriate to the circumstances.
70-71 (2%)You find an armor of cost 1d6+3 wealth or less of your choice as appropriate to the circumstances.
72 (1%)You find an armor of cost 2d4+2 wealth or less of your choice as appropriate to the circumstances.
73-80 (8%)You find an addon of your choice or as appropriate to the circumstances.
81-89 (9%)You find an item of interest related to one of your quests or that might lead to one. Take +2 momentum.
90-100 (11%)Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur.
Ironcrunch - page X
Foe Inflicts Harm

When you face harm from a foe, roll their combat move harm and Endure Harm with the resulting score.

Ironcrunch - page X
Forge a Bond

When you spend significant time with a person or community, stand together to face hardships, or make sacrifices for their cause, you can attempt to create a bond. When you do, roll +heart. If you make this move after you successfully Fulfill Your Vow to their benefit, you may reroll any dice.

On a strong hit, make note of the bond, mark a tick on your bond progress track, and choose one.

  • Take +2 spirit.
  • Take +4 momentum.

On a weak hit, they ask something more of you first. Envision what it is, do it (or Swear an Iron Vow), and mark the bond. If you refuse or fail, Pay the Price.

On a miss, they reject you. Pay the Price.

Ironcrunch - page X
Forsake Your Vow

When you renounce your quest, betray your promise, or the goal is lost to you, clear the vow and Endure Stress. You suffer -spirit equal to the rank of your quest (troublesome=1; dangerous=2; formidable=3; extreme=4; epic=5).

If the vow was made to a person or community with whom you share a bond, Test Your Bond when you next meet.

Ironcrunch - page X
Fulfill Your Vow

Progress Move

When you achieve what you believe to be the fulfillment of your vow, roll the challenge dice and compare to your progress.

On a strong hit, your quest is complete. Mark experience (troublesome=1; dangerous=2; formidable=3; extreme=4; epic=5).

On a weak hit, there is more to be done or you realize the truth of your quest. Envision what you discover. Then, mark experience (troublesome=0; dangerous=1; formidable=2; extreme=3; epic=4). You may Swear an Iron Vow to set things right. If you do, add +1.

If you are fulfilling your vow in service of someone with the means, inclination, or obligation, to reward you materially, take +wealth. On a strong hit, take +wealth equal to the rank of the vow+2. On a weak hit, take +wealth equal to the rank of vow+1. If you are being rewarded with an item, its cost must be the same as the amount of wealth.

On a miss, your quest is undone. Envision what happens, and choose one.

  • You recommit: Clear all but one filled progress, and raise the quests rank by one (if not already epic).
  • You give up: Forsake Your Vow.
Ironcrunch - page X
Gather Information

When you search an area, ask questions, conduct an investigation, or follow a track, roll +wits. If you act within a community or ask questions of a person with whom you share a bond, add +2.

On a strong hit, you discover something helpful and specific. The path you must follow or action you must take to make progress is made clear. Envision what you learn, and take +4 momentum.

On a weak hit, you discover something helpful, but the information complicates your quest or a new danger is introduced. Envision what you discover, and take +2 momentum.

On a miss, your investigation unearths a dire threat or reveals an unwelcome truth that undermines your quest. Pay the Price.

Ironcrunch - page X
Heal

When you receive care or treat an injury or ailment, envision the situation and roll. If you

  • Receive treatment from someone (not an ally or companion): Roll +iron.
  • Mend your own wounds: Roll +iron or +wits, whichever is lower.
  • Provide care: Roll +wits.

On a strong hit, your care is helpful. If you (or the ally under your care) have the palsied, wounded, reeled or dying conditions, you may clear them. Then, take or give up to +4 health.

If you are making this move using an antivenom, clear the poisoned condition instead of the stated above.

On a weak hit, as above, but you must suffer -2 supply or -2 momentum (your choice).

On a miss, the aid is ineffective. Pay the Price.

Ironcrunch - page X
Hearten

When you speak encouraging words, or find a moment of peace, to help you, or someone else, to recover from stress or emotional trauma, roll +heart.

On a strong hit, your heartening is helpful. If you (or the ally under your care) have the shaken condition, you may clear them; you may also reduce the severity of a compulsed and hallucinating conditions by 1. Then, take or give up to +3 spirit.

On a weak hit, as above, but you must suffer -2 momentum and dont reduce the severity of any condition.

On a miss, your aid is ineffective. Pay the Price.

Ironcrunch - page X
Inflict Harm

When you deal physical damage, roll your weapons harm. If you are hitting your foes protection and not breaking their defense rating, subtract your foes protection from each roll. Your foe suffers -health with the resulting score.

Ironcrunch - page X
Learn from Faults

When you spend time taking lessons from your failures and hardships, and your misses track is +6 or greater, roll the challenge dice and compare to your misses.

On a strong hit, your failures have paid off significantly for your personal growth. Take 3 experience and clear all progress. Then, choose one.

  • Rectify your ways: Reduce any stat by 1 and add +1 to any other.
  • Abandon a course: Discard a single asset card (not a companion) and take 2 experience for each marked ability.
  • Commit to a new goal: Swear an Iron Vow now, add +2 and take +2 momentum on a hit You may reroll.
  • Strengthen your willpower: Take +6 momentum.

On a weak hit, you learn from your missteps. Take 2 experience and clear all progress.

On a miss, you learn very little. Take 1 experience and clear all progress.

Ironcrunch - page X
Locate Your Objective

When your exploration of a site comes to an end, roll the challenge dice and compare to your progress.

On a strong hit, you locate your objective and the situation favors you. Choose one.

  • Make another move now (not a progress move), and add +2.
  • Take +2 momentum.

On a weak hit, you locate your objective but face an unforeseen hazard or complication. Envision what you find.

On a miss, your objective falls out of reach, you have been misled about the nature of your objective, or you discover that this site holds unexpected depths. If you continue your exploration, clear all but one filled progress and raise the sites rank by one (if not already epic).

Ironcrunch - page X
Make an Effort

When you make a move demanding more of yourself and have the required effort level, you may suffer -momentum in exchange for the same amount of your move effort level to addition to your roll.

Ironcrunch - page X
Make Camp

When you rest and recover for several hours in the wild, roll +supply.

On a strong hit, if you have the dazed or starved conditions, you may clear them. Then, you and your allies may each choose two.

On a weak hit, as above, but you and your allies may choose one instead.

  • Recuperate: Take +25% of your maximum health. If you have the blinded, deafened or weakened conditions, you may clear them.
  • Partake: Suffer -3 supply and take +25% of maximum health for you and any companions. If you or your companion you are partaking with has the conditions of in the above option, you may clear them.
  • Relax: Take +2 spirit. If you have the unsteady condition, you may clear it.
  • Focus: Take +3 momentum. If you have the stupefied condition, you may clear it.
  • Prepare: When you break camp, add +2 if you Undertake a Journey.

On a miss, you take no comfort. Pay the Price.

Ironcrunch - page X
Manifest Insanity

When you fail to struggle against a mental shock, make the most obvious negative outcome happen from the following tables, or roll on them to determine what kind of insanity you manifest.

1-70 (70%)Short-term Insanity
71-100 (30%)Long-term Insanity
1-28 (28%)You get scared, and your next move should imply to flee as far as possible from the source of the fear or danger.
29-51 (23%)Your spirit is overwhelmed. Take the dazed condition.
52-69 (18%)You show hysteric and emotional outburst by screaming, laughing, crying. Every other ally and companion must Endure Stress (1d2 stress) as a result.
70-87 (18%)You begin babbling, coherently (logorrhoea) or incoherently. Your words show abuse, fear, hopelessness, irrationality or selfishness. Every other ally and companion must Endure Stress (1d3 stress) as a result.
88-95 (8%)You Inflict Harm on yourself.
96-100 (5%)You faint. Take the unconscious condition.
1-15 (15%)Take the phobiac (severity 4) condition.
16-29 (14%)Take the attached (severity 4) condition.
30-36 (7%)Take the hallucinating (severity 2) condition.
37-53 (17%)Take the compulsed (severity 4) condition.
54-57 (4%)You start suffering psychosomatic deafness. Take the deafened (severity +1) condition.
58-60 (3%)You start suffering psychosomatic blindness. Take the blind (severity +1) condition.
61-73 (13%)Take the mute condition.
74-85 (12%)You retreat into your mind, in a stupor state, assuming fetal position if not immediate danger is around, oblivious to events around you. Take the dazed, mute, shaken and unsteady (shaky) conditions.
86-93 (8%)You become catatonic. Take the dazed, mute and numb (severity +1) conditions.
94-98 (5%)Take the amok (severity 3) condition. Then, Clash the nearest target, whether they are an ally, companion, foe or else.
99-00 (2%)Take the amnesiac (severity 5) condition.
Ironcrunch - page X
Not Assist Conditional Companion

When a conditional companion suffers the consequence of one of your moves and you dont come to their aid, suffer -1 to their loyalty.

Ironcrunch - page X
Order Conditional Companion

When you ask a conditional companion to act for something not akin to their drives, motivations or the fulfillment of their goal, or if the conditional companion is a hireling, roll +loyalty. If you share a bond, you may reroll any dice.

On a strong hit, your Conditional Companion Acts, but suffer -1 to their loyalty.

On a weak hit, your Conditional Companion Acts, but not without whimper. Suffer -2 to their loyalty.

On a miss, your conditional companion refuses to follow your request. Suffer -2 to their loyalty.

Ironcrunch - page X
Out of Supply

When your supply is exhausted (reduced to 0), take the unprepared condition. If you suffer additional -supply while unprepared, you must exchange each additional -supply for any combination of -health, -spirit, -wealth, -companions loyalty or -momentum as appropriate to the circumstances.

Ironcrunch - page X
Patch Equipment

When you attempt to amend an armor or shield, envision how provisions from your gear help you patch the piece of equipment and suffer -2 supply. Then, roll +wits.

On a strong hit, your amendment is efficient. Choose one.

  • Rise by 1 your armors protection.
  • Rise by 1 your armors Endure Harm addition.
  • Rise by 1 your shields Face Danger/Clash addition.

On a weak hit, as above, but the patch work takes longer than expected or demand extra resources. Suffer -2 momentum.

On a miss, your craft is ineffective. Pay the Price.

Ironcrunch - page X
Pay the Price

When you suffer the outcome of a move, mark a tick on your miss track; if it is a progress move, mark two; on a match, mark the double. Then, draw a resilience card and choose one.

  • Make the most obvious negative outcome happen.
  • Envision two negative outcomes. Rate one as likely, and Ask the Oracle using the yes/no table. On a yes, make that outcome happen. Otherwise, make it the other.
  • Roll on the following table. If you have difficulty interpreting the result to fit the current situation, roll again.
1-2 (2%)Roll again and apply that result but make it worse. If you roll this result yet again, think of something dreadful that changes the course of your quest and make it happen.
3-5 (3%)A person or community you trusted loses faith in you, or acts against you.
6-8 (3%)A person or community you care about is exposed to danger.
9-15 (7%)You are separated from something or someone.
16-22 (7%)Your action has an unintended effect.
23-29 (7%)Something of value is lost or destroyed.
30-36 (7%)The current situation worsens.
37-43 (7%)A new danger or foe is revealed.
44-52 (9%)It causes a delay or puts you at a disadvantage.
53-61 (9%)It is harmful.
62-70 (9%)It is stressful.
71-77 (7%)It is wasteful.
78-84 (7%)You got a negative condition.
85-89 (5%)A surprising development complicates your quest.
90-94 (5%)It forces you to act against your best intentions.
95-99 (5%)A friend, companion, or ally is put in harms way (or you are, if alone).
100 (1%)Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, make it worse.
Ironcrunch - page X
Reach a Milestone

When you make significant progress in your quest by overcoming a critical obstacle, completing a perilous journey, solving a complex mystery, defeating a powerful threat, gaining vital support, or acquiring a crucial item, you may mark progress.

  • Troublesome quest: Mark 3 progress.
  • Dangerous quest: Mark 2 progress.
  • Formidable quest: Mark 1 progress.
  • Extreme quest: Mark 2 ticks.
  • Epic quest: Mark 1 tick.
Ironcrunch - page X
Reach Your Destination

Progress Move

When your journey comes to an end, roll the challenge dice and compare to your progress. Momentum is ignored on this roll.

On a strong hit, the situation at your destination favors you. Choose one.

  • Make another move now (not a progress move), and add +2.
  • Take +2 momentum.

On a weak hit, you arrive but face an unforeseen hazard or complication. Envision what you find, and take +1 momentum.

On a miss, you have gone hopelessly astray, your objective is lost to you, or you were misled about your destination. If your journey continues, clear all but one filled progress, and raise the journeys rank by one (if not already epic).

Ironcrunch - page X
Resupply

When you hunt, forage or scavenge, roll +wits.

On a strong hit, you bolster your resources. If you have the unprepared condition, you may clear it.Then, take up to +3 supply and +1d2-1 wealth.

On a weak hit, take up to +2 supply, but suffer -1 momentum for each.

On a hit, if you are looting the dead, envision what you loot according to the deads wearing, gear or nature and take +wealth according to its rank. If the rank is...

  • Troublesome: Take +1d2-1
  • Dangerous: Take +1d2 wealth.
  • Formidable: Take +1d3 wealth.
  • Extreme: Take +1d4 wealth.
  • Epic: Take +1d6 wealth.

On a miss, you find nothing helpful or your assumptions betray you. Pay the Price.

Ironcrunch - page X
Reveal a Danger

When you are undertaking a journey and are waylaid by a perilous event, or delving the depths of a site and find yourself in a risky situation, make the most obvious negative outcome happen from the following tables, or roll on them to determine what kind of danger you encounter.

1-25 (25%)Worsening of the Situation
26-60 (35%)Unfavorable Road
61-100 (40%)Hostile Character Encounter
1-13 (13%)A portion of an edible resource got spoiled or lost. Suffer -1 supply. If your supply is 0, reroll on this table.
14-24 (11%)The travel is taking longer than expected. Suffer -1 momentum.
25-34 (10%)The trip was tough and left you tired. Endure Harm (1d4P harm).
35-42 (8%)The travel has drained your energies. Endure Harm (1d4P harm) and take the weakened (severity +1) condition.
43-50 (8%)The travel has left you stressed or mentally fatigued. Endure Stress (1d2 stress).
51-57 (7%)A friend or companion starts arguing for previous acts or complaining about the rough travel. Suffer -1d3 to their loyalty. If you don't have a companion, reroll on this table.
58-64 (7%)You realize you lost some valuable goods on the way. Suffer -2 wealth. If your wealth is reduced to 0, suffer -momentum to any remaining -wealth.
65-71 (7%)You realize too late that the supply container is broken and has a leak. Suffer -2 supply.
72-77 (6%)You realize you lost one of your valuable items on the way. Suffer -1 wealth. If your wealth is 0, reroll on this table.
78-83 (6%)You realize that one of the items you thought to be valuable, is actually not, or not worthy in its current state. Suffer -1 wealth and -1 momentum. If your wealth is an its minimum (0), reroll on this table.
84-89 (6%)You make a discovery that complicates one of your quests. Suffer -2 momentum.
90-94 (5%)A piece of equipment loses durability. Reduce any of your armors or shields values by 1. If you have no armor or shield item, reroll on this table.
95-97 (3%)You start suffering from muscle cramp, sprain or strain. Endure Harm (1d4P harm) and take the palsied (severity 1) condition.
98-99 (2%)You realize that one of your conditional companions is no longer by your side. Suffer -1 momentum. If you don't have a conditional companion, reroll on this table.
100 (1%)Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, double its effect.
1-13 (13%)The terrain or the weather plays against you, hindering you. Subtract -1 to your next move. Take the hyperthermic or hypothermic condition if appropriate.
14-25 (12%)An environmental hazard forces you to pass through this area in a precarious manner. If you make a move to resolve this danger, subtract -1.
26-35 (10%)Whether it is human made or a fortuity of nature, you, or someone with you, is victim of a trap. If you make a move of resolve this danger, subtract -1.
36-44 (9%)You suffer some bruises on the way. Endure Harm (1d4 harm).
45-52 (8%)You consumed some resources, and this road lacks sources to replenish from. Suffer -1 supply. If you Resupply, count a strong hit as a weak hit, and a weak hit as a miss.
53-60 (8%)The travel has been mentally grueling. Endure Stress (1 stress). If you Hearten, count a strong hit as a weak hit, and a weak hit as a miss.
61-68 (8%)You have not reached your waypoint yet, and this stop is too precarious to rest safely. If you Make Camp, count a strong hit as a weak hit, and a weak hit as a miss.
69-75 (7%)The path is broken and there doesn't seem to be a lead to follow it. Subtract -1 next time you Undertake a Journey for this travel.
76-81 (6%)An obstacle is blocking the path you intend to follow. Subtract -1 for your next move to resolve the obstacle or suffer -2 momentum causing a delay on your travel.
82-86 (5%)The path has a disturbing ambience or you find the horrible fate of a victim of this place. Endure Stress (1d4 stress).
87-90 (4%)The environment undermines the path or the weather is disorienting, and you find difficult to recognize the track. Subtract -2 next time you Undertake a Journey for this travel.
91-94 (4%)Whether it was something you ate or something in the surroundings, you are now ill. Endure Harm (1d4P harm) and take the poisoned (severity +1) condition.
95-97 (3%)Whether it was something you ate or something in the surroundings, you got poisoned. Take the poisoned (severity +2) condition.
98-99 (2%)You realized you have been following the wrong path, and trickery leads have left you astray. Clear 1d2 progress boxes in the journey track. Next time you Undertake a Journey, you dont mark progress if you score a hit.
100 (1%)Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, double its effect.
1-13 (13%)You converge with one or multiple travelers or denizens in this area, facing off.
14-26 (13%)One or multiple unaware travelers or denizens are guarding this area, either laid in wait, patrolling or working.
27-39 (13%)You're ambushed, or attacked without warning.
40-51 (12%)Your presence has caught the attention of one or multiple travelers or denizens in the area.
52-63 (12%)Your arrival to this area has been expected.
64-75 (12%)You sense one or multiple presences lurking or stalking.
76-85 (10%)One or multiple unaware travelers or denizens are blocking or undermining the path in some way.
86-93 (8%)You find one or multiple travelers or denizens in unfavorable circumstances.
94-98 (5%)You find one or multiple travelers or denizens pets or underlings.
99-100 (2%)Roll twice more on this table, and use one result.
Ironcrunch - page X
Secure an Advantage

When you assess a situation, make preparations, or attempt to gain leverage, envision your action and roll. If you act...

  • With speed, agility, or precision: Roll +edge.
  • With charm, loyalty, or courage: Roll +heart.
  • With aggressive action, forceful defense, strength, or endurance: Roll +iron.
  • With deception, stealth, or trickery: Roll +shadow.
  • With expertise, insight, or observation: Roll +wits.

    • On a strong hit, you gain advantage. Choose one.

  • Take control: Make another move now (not a progress move), and add +2.
  • Prepare to act: Take +4 momentum.

    • On a weak hit, your advantage is short-lived. Take +2 momentum.

    On a miss, you fail or your assumptions betray you. Pay the Price.

    Ironcrunch - page X
    Show Resilience

    When you make a move, and have in a hand a resilience card with the corresponding suit of the move, these beings

    • Spades (): Combat and suffer moves.
    • Clubs (): Adventure and Delve moves.
    • Hearts (): Relationship, companion and recovery moves.
    • Diamonds (): Quest and asset moves.

    You may

    • Ready yourself to not make previous missteps: Play the resilience card before rolling.
    • Instantly recover from a misstep: Play the resilience card after rolling, but suffer -2 momentum.

    Then, modify the roll as per the value of the card right before reshuffling back into the deck.

    • Ace: You may reroll any dice. Take +4 momentum.
    • K: Score a strong hit, or Inflict Harm once more and make it piercing.
    • Q: Count a miss as a weak hit, and a weak hit as a strong hit; or Inflict Harm once more.
    • J: Score a weak hit, or make the harm piercing.
    • 2-10: Add this amount to the roll.
    Ironcrunch - page X
    Sojourn

    When you spend time in a community, roll +heart. If you share a bond, add +2.

    On strong hit, clear a starved condition; then, you and your allies may each choose two from within the categories below. On a weak hit, choose one. If you share a bond, choose one more.

    On a hit, you and your allies may each reduce the severity of the amnesiac condition by 1, or clear the dazed condition. Then, you and your allies may each focus on one of your chosen recover actions and roll +heart again. If you share a bond, add +2. On a strong hit, take the double for that action. On a weak hit, take +2 more. On a miss, it goes badly and you lose all benefits for that action.

    Clear a Condition

    • Mend: Clear a blinded, deafened, palsied, poisoned, weakened and wounded condition. Then, take 25% of your maximum health.
    • Cheer: Reduce the severity of a compulsed and hallucinating condition by 1, and clear a shaken, stupefied and unsteady condition. Then, take +2 spirit.
    • Equip: Clear an unprepared condition. Then, take +2 supply.

    Recover

    • Recuperate: Take +50% of maximum health for yourself and any companions.
    • Consort: Take +4 spirit.
    • Stock: Take +4 supply.
    • Plan: Take +4 momentum.

    Cohabitate

    • Tune in to the bruits: Envision how you listen for rumors or acquire information from the community. Then, Gather Information, and add +4.
    • Provide aid: Envision what this community needs, or what trouble it is facing. If you chose to help, Swear an Iron Vow and add +2.

    On a miss, you find no help here. Pay the Price.

    Ironcrunch - page X
    Strengthen Their Loyalty

    When you dedicate yourself to spend a significant time with your companion, envision that moment and roll +heart. If your companion is a hireling, roll +wealth instead. If you share a bond, you may reroll any dice.

    On a strong hit, your conditional companion feels more akin with your company. Give +your heart+2 to their loyalty. If the conditional companion is a hireling, also suffer -1 wealth. If you use this exchange to Forge a Bond, make that move now and add +2.

    On a weak hit, as above, but you must also choose one.

    • It was emotionally demanding: Endure Stress (1 stress).
    • It was resource demanding: Suffer -1 supply.
    • It was time consuming: Suffer -2 momentum.

    On a miss, the moment doesnt go as expected. Pay the Price.

    Ironcrunch - page X
    Strike

    When you have initiative and attack with the intent to inflict harm, determine if you are hitting your foes protection or breaking their defense rating. If you are foes protection is 0 or you are doing the latter, fix one challenge die as per your foes defense rating. Then, envision your approach. If you're making this move repeatedly, but with another offensive maneuver, add +1. If you

    • Attack in close quarters: Roll +iron.
    • Attack at range or with a precise weapon: Roll +edge.
    • Attack an unaware target, or without warning, at close range: Roll +shadow.

    On a strong hit, Inflict Harm and add +1. You retain the initiative.

    On a weak hit, Inflict Harm and lose the initiative. If you are attacking at range, choose one.

    • Your attack winged: Roll twice and use the lowest result.
    • You wasted ammo: Suffer -1 supply.
    • Your thrown weapon is lost or destroyed.
    • You attract unexpected attention: Suffer -1 momentum.

    If you are attacking a foe that is unaware and score a hit, envision you strike. On a strong hit, you go undetected; when you Inflict Harm, you may suffer -1 momentum and choose two. On a weak hit, you hit your target, but not without getting spotted; when you Inflict Harm, you may suffer -1 momentum and chose one; then, Enter the Fray.

    • You strike fiercely: Inflict +1d4 harm.
    • You strike on a weak spot: Your harm is penetrating.
    • You find the best way to strike: You may reroll any dice.

    On a miss, your foe has initiative.

    Ironcrunch - page X
    Swear an Iron Vow

    When you swear upon iron to complete a quest, write your vow and give the quest a rank. Then, roll +heart. If you make this vow to a person or community with whom you share a bond, add +2.

    On a strong hit, you are emboldened and it is clear what you must do next. Take +2 momentum.

    On a weak hit, you are determined but begin your quest with more questions than answers. Take +1 momentum, and envision what you do to find a path forward.

    On a miss, you face a significant obstacle before you can begin your quest. Envision what stands in your way, and choose one.

    • You press on: Suffer -2 momentum, and do what you must to overcome this obstacle.
    • You give up: Forsake Your Vow.
    Ironcrunch - page X
    Take a Downtime

    When you spend weeks or months recuperating in a safe place and have at least 1 experience, suffer -1 experience in exchange of the following.

    • Clear your conditions (not corrupted nor maimed).
    • Set your tracks to their maximum.
    • Reset your momentum.
    • Take +2d4+2 wealth.
    Ironcrunch - page X
    Take Conditional Companion

    When you meet a character with the same objective as you, or that is willing to follow you in exchange of getting paid, you may attempt to convince them to join your quest. If you do, roll +heart; if the character is a hireling, roll +wealth instead. If you share a bond, you may reroll any dice.

    On a strong hit, the character joins you as a conditional companion. Fill their companion sheet, setting their loyalty track as your heart+2 (maximum is 10). If the companion is a hireling, suffer -2 wealth.

    On a weak hit, as above, but they ask something of you in return; envision what they want.

    On a miss, the character refuses to join you or make a demand that cost you greatly. Pay the Price.

    Ironcrunch - page X
    Take on Overload

    When you have more weight than your maximum load, take the encumbered condition.

    Ironcrunch - page X
    Test their Loyalty

    When your conditional companions loyalty is at its minimum (0), you can attempt to convince them to stay by your side. If you do, roll +heart. If the companion is a hireling, roll +wealth instead. Add +2 if you share a bond. If their goal is lost to you, count this move as a miss.

    On a strong hit, your companion stands by your side. Give +you heart+1 to their loyalty. Take +1 momentum.

    On a weak hit, as above, but they ask something in return. Choose one.

    • Provisions: Suffer -2 supply.
    • A valuable item: Dicard an equipment or consumable item, or suffer -1 wealth.
    • A promise: Envision what they ask of you that need to be resolved besides their current goal, and Swear an Iron Vow to do it.

    On a miss, or if you have no interest in them to follow you, the Conditional Companion Abandons you. If you share a bond with them, also Test Your Bond.

    Ironcrunch - page X
    Test Your Bond

    When your bond is tested through conflict, betrayal, or circumstance, roll +heart.

    On a strong hit, this test has strengthened your bond. Choose one.

    • Take +2 spirit.
    • Take +4 momentum.

    On a weak hit, your bond is fragile and you must prove your loyalty. Envision what they ask of you, and do it (or Swear an Iron Vow). If you refuse or fail, clear the bond and Pay the Price.

    On a miss, or if you have no interest in maintaining this relationship, clear the bond and Pay the Price.

    Ironcrunch - page X
    Trade

    When you meet someone that offers you an item or service in exchange for wealth, suffer -wealth as the cost of the item or service.

    If you are acquiring supply, suffer -1 wealth in exchange for +2 supply.

    If you are making this move to obtain wealth in exchange for supply or an item (that is not a consumable item), take +1 wealth per -2 supply, or +wealth as per the weight of the item in exchange for losing it.

    Ironcrunch - page X
    Turn the Tide

    Once per fight, when you risk it all, you may steal initiative from your foe to make a move (not a progress move). When you do, add +2 and take +2 momentum on a hit.

    If you fail to score a hit on that move, you must suffer a dire outcome. Pay the Price.

    Ironcrunch - page X
    Undertake a Journey

    When you travel across hazardous or unfamiliar lands, set the rank of your journey.

    • Troublesome journey: 3 progress per waypoint.
    • Dangerous journey: 2 progress per waypoint.
    • Formidable journey: 1 progress per waypoint.
    • Extreme journey: 2 ticks per waypoint.
    • Epic journey: 1 tick per waypoint.

    Then, for each segment of your journey, roll +wits. If you are setting off from a community with which you share a bond, add +2 to your initial roll.

    If you are making this move for the fourth time, without having done the Make Camp move or Sojourn move, take a condition as appropriate to the circumstances.

    On a strong hit, choose one.

    • You make good use of your resources: Mark progress and take +2 momentum.
    • You move with scrutiny: Mark progress and Find an Opportunity.
    • You move at speed: Mark progress twice and take +1 momentum, but suffer -1 supply.

    On a weak hit, choose one.

    • You go as expected: Mark progress, but suffer -1 supply.
    • You move with precaution: Mark progress and Find an Opportunity, but suffer -1 supply and -2 momentum.
    • You move at speed, but with a cost: Mark progress twice and take +1 momentum, but suffer -2 supply and Reveal a Danger.
    • You explore: Find an Opportunity, but suffer -1 momentum.

    On a miss, you have gone hopelessly astray, your objective is lost to you, or you were misled about your destination. If your journey continues, clear all but one filled progress, and raise the journey's rank by one (if not already epic).

    Ironcrunch - page X
    Write Your Epilogue

    Progress Move

    When you retire from your life as an Oathkeeper, envision two things: What you hope for, and what you fear. Then, roll the challenge dice and compare to your bonds.

    On a strong hit, things come to pass as you hoped.

    On a weak hit, your life takes an unexpected turn, but not necessarily for the worse. You find yourself spending your days with someone or in a place you did not foresee. Envision it.

    On a miss, your fears are realized.

    Ironcrunch - page X

     PROGRESS 


     ORACLES 

    Reveal A Danger
    Find An Opportunity
    Manifest Insanity
    Category
    1-25 (25%)Worsening of the Situation
    26-60 (35%)Unfavorable Road
    61-100 (40%)Hostile Character Encounter
    Worsening of the Situation
    1-13 (13%)A portion of an edible resource got spoiled or lost. Suffer -1 supply. If your supply is 0, reroll on this table.
    14-24 (11%)The travel is taking longer than expected. Suffer -1 momentum.
    25-34 (10%)The trip was tough and left you tired. Endure Harm (1d4P harm).
    35-42 (8%)The travel has drained your energies. Endure Harm (1d4P harm) and take the weakened (severity +1) condition.
    43-50 (8%)The travel has left you stressed or mentally fatigued. Endure Stress (1d2 stress).
    51-57 (7%)A friend or companion starts arguing for previous acts or complaining about the rough travel. Suffer -1d3 to their loyalty. If you don't have a companion, reroll on this table.
    58-64 (7%)You realize you lost some valuable goods on the way. Suffer -2 wealth. If your wealth is reduced to 0, suffer -momentum to any remaining -wealth.
    65-71 (7%)You realize too late that the supply container is broken and has a leak. Suffer -2 supply.
    72-77 (6%)You realize you lost one of your valuable items on the way. Suffer -1 wealth. If your wealth is 0, reroll on this table.
    78-83 (6%)You realize that one of the items you thought to be valuable, is actually not, or not worthy in its current state. Suffer -1 wealth and -1 momentum. If your wealth is an its minimum (0), reroll on this table.
    84-89 (6%)You make a discovery that complicates one of your quests. Suffer -2 momentum.
    90-94 (5%)A piece of equipment loses durability. Reduce any of your armors or shields values by 1. If you have no armor or shield item, reroll on this table.
    95-97 (3%)You start suffering from muscle cramp, sprain or strain. Endure Harm (1d4P harm) and take the palsied (severity 1) condition.
    98-99 (2%)You realize that one of your conditional companions is no longer by your side. Suffer -1 momentum. If you don't have a conditional companion, reroll on this table.
    100 (1%)Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, double its effect.
    Unfavorable Road
    1-13 (13%)The terrain or the weather plays against you, hindering you. Subtract -1 to your next move. Take the hyperthermic or hypothermic condition if appropriate.
    14-25 (12%)An environmental hazard forces you to pass through this area in a precarious manner. If you make a move to resolve this danger, subtract -1.
    26-35 (10%)Whether it is human made or a fortuity of nature, you, or someone with you, is victim of a trap. If you make a move of resolve this danger, subtract -1.
    36-44 (9%)You suffer some bruises on the way. Endure Harm (1d4 harm).
    45-52 (8%)You consumed some resources, and this road lacks sources to replenish from. Suffer -1 supply. If you Resupply, count a strong hit as a weak hit, and a weak hit as a miss.
    53-60 (8%)The travel has been mentally grueling. Endure Stress (1 stress). If you Hearten, count a strong hit as a weak hit, and a weak hit as a miss.
    61-68 (8%)You have not reached your waypoint yet, and this stop is too precarious to rest safely. If you Make Camp, count a strong hit as a weak hit, and a weak hit as a miss.
    69-75 (7%)The path is broken and there doesn't seem to be a lead to follow it. Subtract -1 next time you Undertake a Journey for this travel.
    76-81 (6%)An obstacle is blocking the path you intend to follow. Subtract -1 for your next move to resolve the obstacle or suffer -2 momentum causing a delay on your travel.
    82-86 (5%)The path has a disturbing ambience or you find the horrible fate of a victim of this place. Endure Stress (1d4 stress).
    87-90 (4%)The environment undermines the path or the weather is disorienting, and you find difficult to recognize the track. Subtract -2 next time you Undertake a Journey for this travel.
    91-94 (4%)Whether it was something you ate or something in the surroundings, you are now ill. Endure Harm (1d4P harm) and take the poisoned (severity +1) condition.
    95-97 (3%)Whether it was something you ate or something in the surroundings, you got poisoned. Take the poisoned (severity +2) condition.
    98-99 (2%)You realized you have been following the wrong path, and trickery leads have left you astray. Clear 1d2 progress boxes in the journey track. Next time you Undertake a Journey, you dont mark progress if you score a hit.
    100 (1%)Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, double its effect.
    Hostile Character Encounter
    1-13 (13%)You converge with one or multiple travelers or denizens in this area, facing off.
    14-26 (13%)One or multiple unaware travelers or denizens are guarding this area, either laid in wait, patrolling or working.
    27-39 (13%)You're ambushed, or attacked without warning.
    40-51 (12%)Your presence has caught the attention of one or multiple travelers or denizens in the area.
    52-63 (12%)Your arrival to this area has been expected.
    64-75 (12%)You sense one or multiple presences lurking or stalking.
    76-85 (10%)One or multiple unaware travelers or denizens are blocking or undermining the path in some way.
    86-93 (8%)You find one or multiple travelers or denizens in unfavorable circumstances.
    94-98 (5%)You find one or multiple travelers or denizens pets or underlings.
    99-100 (2%)Roll twice more on this table, and use one result.
    Category
    1-55 (25%)Favorable Area.
    56-80 (35%)Benign Character Encounter.
    81-100 (40%)Item Finding
    Favorable Area
    1-11(11%)The travel took shorter than expected. Take +1 momentum.
    12-20 (9%)Elements of this area can be used to leverage your travel. If you Undertake a Journey, you may reroll any dice.
    21-28 (8%)There is a path that seems to lead towards your destination. If you follow it, add +2 when you Undertake a Journey.
    29-35 (7%)The travel has cleared your mind. If you Hearten, reroll any dice.
    36-42 (7%)This seems to be an ideal place to find a moment of peace. If you Hearten, add +2.
    43-49 (7%)This seems to be an ideal place to bolster your reserves. If you Resupply, add +2.
    50-55 (6%)This seems to be a place safe enough to rest and recover for several hours. If you Make Camp, add +2.
    56-61 (6%)You find a healthy settlement. If you Sojourn, add +1.
    62-66 (5%)This area offers a captivating ambience or comfortable environment. If you Hearten, take +1 spirit on a hit.
    67-71 (5%)This area offers enough to bolster your reserves if you dedicate enough to it. If you Resupply and score hit, you may suffer -1 momentum in exchange for +1 supply.
    72-76 (5%)This waypoint offers more than needed for a modest rest. If you Make Camp, and score a hit, you may choose an extra option.
    77-80 (4%)You seem to be closer to your destination than expected. Mark an additional progress in your journey track.
    81-83 (3%)This area offers just what you need to camp. If you Make Camp, you may reroll any dice.
    84-86 (3%)You reach this waypoint just at an opportune time to bolster your reserves. If you Resupply now, you may reroll any dice.
    87-88 (2%)There is a hidden passage that could be a shortcut. If you Reach Your Destination, you may reroll any dice.
    89-96 (8%)You reach a location of interest related to one of your quests or that might lead to one. Take +2 momentum.
    97-98 (2%)Choose one result from this table.
    99-100 (2%)Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur.
    Benign Character Encounter
    1-16 (16%)You encounter a traveler or denizen who might provide you guide in exchange for something of value. If you agree, suffer -1 wealth or -2 supply (your choice) in exchange for adding +3 next time you Undertake a Journey for this travel.
    17-30 (14%)You encounter a traveler or denizen willing to provide you guide and supply. If he does, add +1 next time you Undertake a Journey for this travel and take +1 supply.
    31-38 (8%)You encounter a traveler or denizen who might provide you health care in exchange for something of value. If you agree, suffer -1 wealth or -2 supply (your choice) in exchange for making the Hearten move now and add +3.
    39-46 (8%)You encounter a traveler or denizen who might rise your spirit in exchange for something of value. If you agree, suffer -1 wealth or -2 supply (your choice) in exchange for making the Heal move now and add +3.
    47-53 (7%)You encounter a traveler or denizen willing to rise your spirit. If he does, Hearten now and add +2.
    54-60 (7%)You encounter a traveler or denizen willing to give you first aid. If he does, Heal now and add +2.
    61-70 (10%)You encounter a provision trader.
    71-75 (5%)You encounter an equipment trader.
    76-79 (4%)You encounter a traveler or denizen with the potential of being a conditional companion with the goal of serving as hireling and the drive of getting wealth. If you Take a Conditional Companion, add +1.
    80-83 (4%)You encounter a traveler or denizen with the potential of being a conditional companion. Take +1 momentum.
    84-86 (3%)You encounter one or more travelers or denizens in need for help and with the means to reward you.
    87-95 (9%)You encounter one or more characters related to one of you quests or that might lead to one. Take +2 momentum.
    96-98 (3%)Roll twice more on this table. Use one result.
    99-100 (2%)Choose one result from this table.
    Item Finding
    1-14 (14%)You find resources that bolster your reserves. Take +1 supply.
    15-26 (12%)You find resources that bolster your reserves. Take +2 supply.
    27-35 (9%)You find some valuable goods. Take +2 wealth.
    36-42 (7%)You find some valuable goods. Take +2 wealth.
    43-47 (5%)You find a consumable item of your choice or as appropriate to the circumstances.
    48-51 (4%)You find two consumable items of your choice or as appropriate to the circumstances.
    52-56 (5%)You find a weapon of cost d4 wealth cost or less of your choice as appropriate to the circumstances.
    57-59 (3%)You find a weapon of cost d6 wealth or less of your choice as appropriate to the circumstances.
    60-61 (2%)You find a weapon of cost d8+1 wealth or less of your choice as appropriate to the circumstances.
    62-64 (3%)You find a shield of cost d4+1 wealth or less of your choice as appropriate to the circumstances.
    65-66 (2%)You find a shield of cost d6+1 wealth or less of your choice as appropriate to the circumstances.
    67-69 (3%)You find an armor of cost 1d4+3 wealth or less of your choice or as appropriate to the circumstances.
    70-71 (2%)You find an armor of cost 1d6+3 wealth or less of your choice as appropriate to the circumstances.
    72 (1%)You find an armor of cost 2d4+2 wealth or less of your choice as appropriate to the circumstances.
    73-80 (8%)You find an addon of your choice or as appropriate to the circumstances.
    81-89 (9%)You find an item of interest related to one of your quests or that might lead to one. Take +2 momentum.
    90-100 (11%)Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur.
    Category
    1-70 (70%)Short-term Insanity
    71-100 (30%)Long-term Insanity
    Short-term
    1-28 (28%)You get scared, and your next move should imply to flee as far as possible from the source of the fear or danger.
    29-51 (23%)Your spirit is overwhelmed. Take the dazed condition.
    52-69 (18%)You show hysteric and emotional outburst by screaming, laughing, crying. Every other ally and companion must Endure Stress (1d2 stress) as a result.
    70-87 (18%)You begin babbling, coherently (logorrhoea) or incoherently. Your words show abuse, fear, hopelessness, irrationality or selfishness. Every other ally and companion must Endure Stress (1d3 stress) as a result.
    88-95 (8%)You Inflict Harm on yourself.
    96-100 (5%)You faint. Take the unconscious condition.
    Long-term
    1-15 (15%)Take the phobiac (severity 4) condition.
    16-29 (14%)Take the attached (severity 4) condition.
    30-36 (7%)Take the hallucinating (severity 2) condition.
    37-53 (17%)Take the compulsed (severity 4) condition.
    54-57 (4%)You start suffering psychosomatic deafness. Take the deafened (severity +1) condition.
    58-60 (3%)You start suffering psychosomatic blindness. Take the blind (severity +1) condition.
    61-73 (13%)Take the mute condition.
    74-85 (12%)You retreat into your mind, in a stupor state, assuming fetal position if not immediate danger is around, oblivious to events around you. Take the dazed, mute, shaken and unsteady (shaky) conditions.
    86-93 (8%)You become catatonic. Take the dazed, mute and numb (severity +1) conditions.
    94-98 (5%)Take the amok (severity 3) condition. Then, Clash the nearest target, whether they are an ally, companion, foe or else.
    99-00 (2%)Take the amnesiac (severity 5) condition.

    COMBAT ACTION
    1-3 Compel a surrender.
    4-6Coordinate with allies.
    7-9 Gather reinforcements.
    10-13Seize something or someone.
    14-17Provoke a reckless response.
    18-21Intimidate or frighten.
    22-25Reveal a surprising truth.
    26-29Shift focus to someone or something else.
    30-33Destroy something, or render it useless.
    34-39 Take a decisive action.
    40-45Reinforce defenses.
    46-52Ready an action.
    53-60 Use the terrain to gain advantage.
    61-68Leverage the advantage of a weapon or ability.
    69-78Create an opportunity.
    79-89Attack with precision.
    90-99Attack with power.
    100 Take a completely unexpected action.

    1-2Outsiders rejected
    3-4Dangerous discovery
    5-6Dreadful omens

    9-10 Old wounds reopened
    11-12Important object is lost
    13-14Someone is captured

    37-38 In league with the enemy
    39-40Raiders prey on the weak

    43-44 An innocent is accused
    45-46Corrupted by dark magic
    47-48Isolated by brutal weather
    49-50Provisions are scarce

    55-56Attack is imminent

    87-88Important event threatened
    89-90Dangerous tradition
    91-100 Roll twice
    MAJOR PLOT TWIST
    1-5 It was all a diversion.
    6-10 A dark secret is revealed.
    11-15 A trap is sprung.
    16-20 An assumption is revealed to be false.
    21-25 A secret alliance is revealed.
    26-30 Your actions benefit an enemy.
    31-35Someone returns unexpectedly.
    36-40 A more dangerous foe is revealed.
    41-45 You and an enemy share a common goal.
    46-50 A true identity is revealed.
    51-55 You are betrayed by someone who was trusted.
    56-60 You are too late.
    61-65 The true enemy is revealed.
    66-70 The enemy gains new allies.
    71-75 A new danger appears.
    76-80Someone or something goes missing.
    81-85 The truth of a relationship is revealed.
    86-90 Two seemingly unrelated situations are shown to be connected.
    91-95Unexpected powers or abilities are revealed.
    96-100 Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, make it more dramatic.
    MYSTIC BACKLASH
    1-4 Your ritual has the opposite effect.
    5-8 You are sapped of strength.
    9-12 Your friend, ally, or companion is adversely affected.
    13-16 You destroy an important object.
    17-20 You inadvertently summon a horror.
    21-24 You collapse, and drift into a troubled sleep.
    25-28 You undergo a physical torment which leaves its mark upon you.
    29-32 You hear ghostly voices whispering of dark portents.
    33-36 You are lost in shadow, and find yourself in another place without memory of how you got there.
    37-40 You alert someone or something to your presence.
    41-44 You are not yourself, and act against a friend, ally, or companion.
    45-48 You affect or damage your surroundings, causing a disturbance or potential harm.
    49-52 You waste resources.
    53-56 You suffer the loss of a sense for several hours.
    57-60 You lose your connection to magic for a day or so, and cannot perform rituals.
    61-64 Your ritual affects the target in an unexpected and problematic way.
    65-68 Your ritual reveals a surprising and troubling truth.
    69-72 You are tempted by dark powers.
    73-76 You see a troubling vision of your future.
    77-80 You can't perform this ritual again until you acquire an important component.
    81-84 You develop a strange fear or compulsion.
    85-88 Your ritual causes creatures to exhibit strange or aggressive behavior.
    89-92 You are tormented by an apparition from your past.
    93-96 You are wracked with sudden sickness.
    97-100 Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, make it worse.

    SETTLEMENT NAME
    01-15 A feature of the landscape. Envision what it is. What makes it unusual or distinctive?
    16-30 A manmade edifice. What is it? Why is it important to this settlement’s history?
    31-45 A creature. Why have the people of this settlement chosen this creature as their totem? How is it represented in art or rituals?
    46-60 A historical event. What happened here? What place or practice commemorates this event?
    61-75 A word in an Old World language. What culture is represented by this word? What does it translate to?
    76-90 A season or environmental aspect. What influence does the weather have on this settlement?
    91-100Something Else....

    PAY THE PRICE
    1-2 Roll again and apply that result but make it worse. If you roll this result yet again, think of something dreadful that changes the course of your quest (Ask the Oracle if unsure) and make it happen.
    3-5 A person or community you trusted loses faith in you, or acts against you.
    6-9 A person or community you care about is exposed to danger.
    10-16 You are separated from something or someone.
    17-23 Your action has an unintended effect.
    24-32Something of value is lost or destroyed.
    33-41 The current situation worsens.
    42-50 A new danger or foe is revealed.
    51-59 It causes a delay or puts you at a disadvantage.
    60-68 It is harmful.
    69-77 It is stressful.
    78-85 A surprising development complicates your quest.
    86-90 It wastes resources.
    91-94 It forces you to act against your best intentions.
    95-98 A friend, companion, or ally is put in harm’s way (or you are, if alone)
    99-100 Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, make it worse.
    ASK THE ORACLE
    11 or greater Almost Certain
    26 or greaterLikely
    51 or greater50/50
    76 or greaterUnlikely
    91 or greater Small Chance
    On a match, an extreme result or twist has occurred.
    ENDURE HARM
    1-10 (10%)The harm is mortal. Face Death.
    11-20 (10%)Take the dying condition.
    21-35 (15%)Take theunconscious condition.
    36-50 (15%)Take the reeled condition.
    51-100 (50%)You are battered but still standing.
    ENDURE STRESS
    1-10 (10%)You are overwhelmed. Face Desolation.
    11-25 (15%)You give up. Forsake Your Vow (if possible, one relevant to your current crisis). If this is a companion, Test Their Loyalty.
    26-50 (25%)You give in to a fear or compulsion, and act against your better instincts. Manifest Insanity.
    51-80 (30%)You persevere.
    81-85 (5%)You get a moment of clarity in the eye of the storm. If you have the shaken condition card, discard it. Take +4 spirit and +8 momentum. Then, add +2 to your next move.
    86-90 (5%)You get virtuous in the face of chaos. If you have the shaken condition card, discard it. Then, take +4 spirit and draw up to your maximum of resilience cards.
    91-95 (5%)Your body harvest vigor. If you have the shaken condition card, discard it. Then, take +4 spirit and +1d12 health.
    96-100 (5%)Your spirit shines brightest against a backdrop of desolation. If you have the shaken condition card, discard it. Then, take +8 spirit.

    Monstrosity: Size
    1-5Tiny (rodent-sized)
    6-30Small (hound-sized)
    31-65Medium (person-sized)
    66-94Large (giant-sized)
    95-99Huge (whale-sized)
    100Titanic (incomprehensible)
    Monstrosity: Primary Form
    1-15Beast / mammal
    16-25Humanoid
    26-31Bird
    32-37Spider
    38-43Snake
    44-49Worm / slug
    50-55Lizard
    56-61Insect
    62-66Amorphous

    70-71Fish
    72-73Octopoid
    74-75Amphibian
    76-77Plant
    78Incorporeal
    79Mineral
    80Elemental
    81-100Hybrid (roll twice)
    Monstrosity: Characteristics
    1-5Extra limbs
    6-10Fangs / rows of sharp teeth
    11-15Claws / talons
    16-20Strange color / markings
    21-25Horns / tusks
    26-30Oversized mouth
    31-35Spikes / spines
    36-40Tail
    41-45Multi-segmented body
    46-50Wings
    51-54Stinger / barbs

    70-72Luminescent

    99Multi-headed

    Threat: Category
    1-10Burgeoning Conflict
    11-20Cursed Site
    21-30Environmental Calamity

    81-90Zealous Cult
    91-100Roll Twice
    Threat: Burgeoning Conflict
    1-10Allow warmongers to gain influence
    11-20Break a treaty
    21-30Force a hasty decision
    31-40Deepen suspicions
    41-50Trigger a confrontation
    51-60Subvert a potential accord
    61-70Isolate the antagonists
    71-80Draw new battle lines
    81-90Reveal an unexpected aspect of the dispute
    91-100 Introduce a new person or faction to complicate the situation
    Threat: Cursed Site
    1-10Unleash a creature or being
    11-20Lure the unwary into its depths
    21-30Offer promises of power
    31-40Reveal a new aspect of its cursed history
    41-50Expand its malignancy to surrounding lands
    51-60Leave its mark on an inhabitant or visitor
    61-70Reveal hidden depths
    71-80Ensnare an important person or object
    81-90Corrupt the environment
    91-100Transform its nature
    Threat: Environmental Calamity

    11-20Block a path

    41-50Expand in scope or intensity
    51-60Allow someone to take advantage
    61-70Deprive of resources
    71-80Isolate an important person or community
    81-90Force refugees into hostile lands
    91-100Disrupt natural ecosystems
    Threat: Malignant Plague
    1-10Manifest new symptoms or effects
    11-20Infect someone important
    21-30Expand to new territory or communities
    31-40Allow someone to take advantage
    41-50Allow someone to take the blame
    51-60Create panic or disorder
    61-70Force a horrible decision
    71-80Lure into complacency
    81-90Reveal the root of the sickness
    91-100Undermine a potential cure
    Threat: Rampaging Creature
